oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Effects of Maternal IBD and IBD Breast Milk on Neonatal Gut Microbiome and Intestinal Inflammation
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Huang, Vivian
Madsen, Karen
Fedorak, Richard
Elahi, Shokrollah
Dieleman, Levinus
Wine, Eytan
Agrawal, Ambika
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The objective of the study is to compare the intestinal inflammatory response markers of infants born to healthy mothers versus IBD mothers. As well, the fecal microbiome of infants who are breast fed by healthy mothers versus IBD mothers, and the immunoactive components of breast milk from healthy mothers versus IBD mothers, will be compared.

oai_dc:dc.dc:relation: Elevated Fecal Calprotectin in the Second or Third Trimester of Pregnancy Predicts Preterm Delivery in Women with IBD
